title: Graver basis
summary: In applied mathematics, Graver bases enable iterative solutions of linear and various nonlinear integer programming problems in polynomial time.  They were introduced by Jack E. Graver.[1] Their connection to the theory of Gr√∂bner bases was discussed by Bernd Sturmfels.[2] The algorithmic theory of Graver bases and its application to integer programming is described by Shmuel Onn.[3][4]
